TopicTitle: The Kerbal Glossary! Your one stop Jargon Busting Thread.

Articles.Content:
Welcome to the Kerbal Glossary! Here, You can search through hundreds of alphabetically-sorted terms and definitions. You can post any terms we left out below and I will add them to the list! This Thread is being Maintained by me, ZodiaK.

JUMP TO:

A

  • Asteroid- Small Rocky Objects that Spawn near Kerbin and Dres. (see Dresteroids) Some contain Ore that is mineable.
  • Apoapsis- the highest point in an orbit.

B

C

  • Clipping- Or 'Part Clipping' Referring to the act of moving one part within the mesh of another. Some argue that it is an exploit of the game's Mechanics.

D

  • Duna- A Rocky Planet Between Kerbin and Dres. Noted for its distinctive red color.
  • Dres- A Rocky Planet Between Duna and Jool. Noted for its orbital Inclination and 'Dresteroids' that spawn in orbit around it
  • Dresteroids- Asteroids that spawn in Orbit around Dres.
  • Delta V- (ÃŽâ€v) The total Change in velocity Capable by a Spacecraft. measured in meters/second.

E

F

G

H

I

J

K

  • Kerbal- The small, Green alien race that Inhabit Kerbin.
  • Kerbin- A Rocky Planet between Eve and Duna. Home to the space-faring Kerbals.
  • KSP- Short for Kerbal Space Program, The Game that is this forum's subject.
  • Kerbol- The Star at the center of the Kerbol System. All planets orbit it. Notable for being a Pun on 'Kerbal' and 'Sol'
  • KSC- Kerbal Space Center, the space center from which rockets are built and launched.
  • Kraken- A name for a Variety of Game-breaking Bugs that are related to floating-point imprecision. Derived from mythical sea beast of the same name.

L

M

  • Monolith- Anomaly present on many bodies in the Kerbol system.
  • Mun- Kerbin's closest natural Satellite.

N

O

  • Ore- A Mine-able resource found on most rocky bodies in the Kerbol system. Can be converted into fuel.

P

  • Prograde- The direction in which you are moving.
  • Periapsis- The Lowest point in an orbit.

Q

R

  • Retrograde- The Opposite direction to the direction in which you are moving

S

T

U

V

X

Y

Z

#

Edited May 6, 2015 by ZodiaK

Delta V - Essentially the amount you are able to change your velocity based on the amount of fuel you have, the efficiency of your engines and your overall weight.

Prograde - Facing the directing in which you are orbiting (forwards).

Retrograde - The opposite direction to prograde.

TWR - Thrust to weight ratio. The the power your engines output divided by your weight.

Aerocapture - Dipping into an atmosphere to achieve orbit from a hyperbolic trajectory, what many KSP players mistaken call "Aerobraking".

Aerobraking - The process of lowering one's apoapsis by dipping into an atmosphere when the apoapsis is within the planetary sphere of influence.

LFO - Liquid Fuel / Oxidizer

Ore - Magical Faerie Poop

Kerbol - A star that makes literally no sense.

Kerbin - A magical Ceres-sized planet.

Dresteroids? Seriously, who thought that was a good idea?

Not to be that guy, but there's already something like this in the wiki. But I think it would be a neat idea to turn this into a less formal dictionary, like the Dresteroids thing, which I consider a genius idea.

like the Dresteroids thing, which I consider a genius idea.

don't say that, Regex will gouge your eyes out XD

Jebediah Kerman - The stupidest bravest pilot in the Kerbal Space Program. Not much makes him scared - if he is scared, well... RIP

Edited May 5, 2015 by ToTheMun
formatting

Lithobraking: An attempt to slow down in a similar fashion to aerobraking, except using a planet's solid surface in place of its atmosphere. Extremely dangerous.

Kraken: Officially, a colloquial term for a variety of game-breaking bugs that can occur during flight, especially those related to floating-point imprecision; unofficially, an invisible space beast that destroys spacecraft when the player least expects it.

I need to get some sleep, but I may be back with more suggestions tomorrow.
M - "moar" indicating the need for further refinements in thrust levels.

R - Rendez-vous when two french vessels are trying to smash each others

D - Delta-V - The speed you don't have

Edited May 5, 2015 by Herr Rictus Bingo
Maybe define "part clipping" or "clipping"? I've never quite understood what this is and why it might be good or bad.

Monolith: Anomaly of some long-forgotten origin.

Magic Boulder: Old easter egg, a mysterious glowing rock, formerly in Ike orbit.
Working on adding more definitions- keep em' coming!

Periapsis : Point of the orbit closest to a planet

Apoapsis : Point of the orbit farthest away from a planet.

Periapsis : Point of the orbit closest to a planet

Apoapsis : Point of the orbit farthest away from a planet.

ooh- good ones! adding them now!
